intro: Malva crispa, commonly known as the velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are borne on long, slender stalks. Malva crispa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional herbal remedies.
